page.title: 19Law and Order in Gourdon
page.content: The{old Police House at 46 Brae Road where the Anderson family now live was built around 1885-87. It had at that time one cell in one room. There was only 1 policeman and 46 Brae Road was used as the police house for approximately 35 years. Before the police used the house in Brae Road it was a private house which it is now once again. The cottage across from the lighthouse in Brae Road was the original police station. Today nearby{Bervie Police Station}is a partially manned office (messages can be left on a teleprinter) with 3 officers serving the local communities including Gourdon in their patrol cars. The opening of the Bervie Police Station made it no longer necessary to have a village bobby based in Gourdon.
